cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 230 mi E of Tampico, Mexico, or 330 mi SE of the mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander slowly in the western Gulf, then turn north-northwest and west toward the middle-upper Texas coast through the weekend into Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle to upper Texas coast near Matagorda Bay / Freeport area

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches in effect yet along the U.S. coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings in effect yet along the U.S. coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf coast from Tampico, MX northward to the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, higher gusts) possible late Sat night through Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible along the upper Texas coast and into Galveston Bay, including the Texas City Ship Channel
weather_observation.rainfall: Slow-moving system could bring 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts early next week
weather_observation.other_hazards: Coastal flooding, dangerous surf and rip currents that could hamper port operations
